answers.answer: I am not a physician, but the mom of a type 1 diabetic and the daughter of a type 2.  I would suggest that you see your doctor about these symptoms.   Neurotrpathy is complication diabetes.  However from experiences with my mom some of the symptoms can also be signs of other problems.  I would suggest calling your doctor your and have him /her check you out.Hope all goes well.

question: I am diabetic and have been for 16 years.  I have experienced several stomach problems over the last 6 years.  Recently I have been getting a lot of pain in my right shoulder and my arm goes completely numb.  I have some numbness in my left arm but nothing like my right arm.  I am wondering what this could be?  I am very worried.  I am also a smoker and would like to know if that has anything to do with it.
title: Arm Numbness
